newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-RONALDO MAY SIGN FOR US BY WEEKEND - INTER.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-RONALDO MAY SIGN FOR US BY WEEKEND - INTER.

text.p: Internazionale Milan president Massimo Moratti expects Barcelona's unsettled Brazil striker Ronaldo to sign for the Italian club in the next few days.
"I hope to give the announcement by the end of the week," Moratti told reporters on Wednesday. "Let us hope so for Italian soccer and for Inter.
"Now there will be further meetings to better define some aspects, but I think all will go well," he added.
Ronaldo, currently playing for his country in the Tournoi de France, confirmed on Wednesday he was all but finished with Barcelona and would probably join an Italian club next season.
"The decision is the same that I took last week, I have no reason to change it," he said.
"I'll probably play in Italy," Ronaldo added at Brazil's Tounoi training camp near Lyon.

"For the moment I am a Barcelona player, but I already have the letter with the money to pay the clause," he said after a 50-minute meeting with his Brazilian agents Alexandre Martins and Reinaldo Pitta.
Ronaldo can buy his freedom of movement from Barcelona for some $32 million according to a clause in his contract.

Barcelona announced last week that the 20-year-old striker had signed for another nine years at the Spanish club for $3.5 million a season. But problems with the payment of a $14 million one-off bonus scuppered the contract talks.
